question: How many vehicles do you have and how long have you been in business?
answer: We currently have 17 vehicles and have been in operation since August 2011.

question: Do you offer one-way and round-trip service options?
answer: Yes, we offer one-way morning, one-way afternoon or round-trip service options.

question: Do you offer sibling discounts?
answer: Yes, we offer sibling discounts at the 10, 15 and 20% levels.

question: Do you offer half-day service, early release and/or delayed opening service?
answer: We offer half-day service when it is a school-wide half-day dismissal. We also offer service when school is dismissed early due to weather or other conditions. Additionally, we offer service when school is delayed in opening due to inclement weather or other reasons.

question: Do you offer partial year service?
answer: In the beginning of the year, we only offer full-year,  ve-day week service. In January of each year, we offer partial year service. We do offer intermittent service via our On Call Service.

question: How are your routes determined?
answer: For our parent-paid service, our routes and stops are determined by parent need. We examine the areas where the need is the greatest and develop routes that are no longer than 50-60 minutes.  e stops are based on central location pick up and drop o .

question: Why don’t you have pricing on your website?
answer: We do not provide pricing on our website, as each school is priced differently. Each charter school has a different academic calendar and number of attendance days.

question: How do you train your drivers?
answer: Training our Drivers begins with the driver/route paperwork and pre-trip inspection methods.  e new Driver rides with a Trainer on their assigned route for at least two days, then drives the route for several days without passengers, and when route-ready, they are permitted to drive under supervision. Trainees with experience driving a school bus may exit the training program more quickly. Typically, we average 15-20 hours of training before we permit a driver to be on board with students. Once brought on board, every driver must attend quarterly driver safety meetings where topics such as bullying, student behavior management, adverse weather conditions, etc. are addressed.

question: Do you perform background checks on your drivers?
answer: Our hiring process includes a background check, as well as obtaining a motor vehicle driving record from the DMV and we request safety and drug testing information from all the applicants’ employers for the past three years.

question: What does the DOT number on the side of your vehicles indicate?
answer: Our DOT number can be used on the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration website to checkout our safety record. Secondly, it indicates that we are subject to a yearly inspection by a DOT regulated inspector.  ird, the number is an indicator that our drivers are a part of a drug and alcohol testing program. Finally, it indicates that our drivers must adhere to annual review and inspection of their driving records, as well as the obtainment of a federal medical examination certificate.

question: How do you manage a school’s transportation fleet?
answer: Once we are asked to examine a school’s transportation program, we make recommendations to best streamline the process already in place. We also make recommendations for additional driver training, addition of equipment, route optimization, and safety measures.

question: Can a school contract out part or all of their busing to Olympic?
answer: Absolutely. As charter schools grow in number and in attendance, schools that attempt to provide busing can sometimes become overwhelmed with the intense amount of effort and training that transportation can take. Olympic can bring their equipment and expertise to any charter school and provide a transportation solution as directed by the Board. Whether it’s one bus or 10, one route or 5, we can provide a turn-key or management solution for the benefit of the parents, the students and the school.

question: Do you do  field trips or special outings?
answer: Yes, we provide  field trips throughout the entire State of North Carolina. We will also provide transport for special outings such as scouting events, summer camps, and group transport.
